headline: Gillian Battino expected to leave Democratic U.S. Senate race and announce run for state treasurer
author: Bill Glauber
sentences:
More:Mandela Barnes raises $1.23 million during last 3 months of 2021 in Wisconsin U.S. Senate race
In joining the state treasurer race, Battino is expected to build on what she learned on the campaign trail over the past year, with voters raising concerns about such issues as rural broadband, health care and financial insecurity.

On the Democratic side, the primary field includes Angelito Tenorio, a member of the West Allis Common Council; Aaron Richardson, mayor of Fitchburg; and former state Treasurer Dawn Marie Sass of Belleville.
The Democrat and first-time candidate is expected to end her campaign for U.S. Senate this week and will instead announce a run for state treasurer, the Milwaukee Journal Sentinel has learned.
Mandela Barnes, state Treasurer Sarah Godlewski, Outagamie County Executive Tom Nelson and Alex Lasry, on leave from his executive job with the Milwaukee Bucks.
Republican candidates include Orlando Owens of Milwaukee, who is an aide to Republican U.S. Sen. Ron Johnson, and Jeanette Deschene of Manitowoc.
In her Senate run, Battino loaned her campaign $125,000, according to federal filings, and had $14,000 cash on hand at the end of 2021.
Even though the office's responsibilities have been chipped away over the years, the winner will gain a statewide platform.
After entering the Senate race in May, Battino was unable to gain traction in a crowded primary field.
Wausau radiologist Gillian Battino is getting poised to switch political races.
The race for state treasurer has been a more low-profile campaign.
A formal announcement could come as early as Thursday.
That race has been dominated by Lt. Gov.
